title: hitting Ctrl+C twice doesn't actually kill the node
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--A clear and concise description of what the bug is and steps to reproduce it.-->
When running the beacon node, I hit Ctrl+C twice, and the node isn't actually killed.

**Expected behavior**
<!--A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.-->
I know that the Ctrl+C x2 solution is only stop-gap for cleanly exiting all the processes of the node, but I would still expect it to really kill the node regardless.
To clarify, it seems this only happens sometimes.  Not sure what the root cause is at this moment.

Could you record your terminal to see exactly at what point of the node lifetime it happens? For me, I've seen CTRL+C doesn't working when the process is stuck in a long synchronous task, which happens on bootup.

Here's an example I just ran into:

```
fcda4e2c0ea81, slot=941, epoch=29
2020-09-04 12:17:23  [CHAIN]            info: Processed new chain head newChainHeadRoot=0xd35e83daa002fddc87fe9095a2b3133e49ed3462a6b1a010643ae769581a6030, slot=944, epoch=29
```
